content.raw: I’m running `ign launch -v 5 urban_circuit.ign headless:=true worldName:=simple_urban_03 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`  with joystick control. `X1` is spawn at \(0, 0\) position. After driving a loop along 1 m square, `X1/odom/pose/pose/position` is at \(0, 0\) again as expected. Driving 20-30 m around the staging area and returning to starting position shows odometry over 10 m off. Driving down the ramp and returning shows huge odometry error. Is it on purpose? Do I have to calculate odometry myself?
content.html: I’m running ign launch -v 5 urban_circuit.ign headless:=true worldName:=simple_urban_03 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 with joystick control. X1 is spawn at (0, 0) position. After driving a loop along 1 m square, X1/odom/pose/pose/position is at (0, 0) again as expected. Driving 20-30 m around the staging area and returning to starting position shows odometry over 10 m off. Driving down the ramp and returning shows huge odometry error. Is it on purpose? Do I have to calculate odometry myself?
